params._basedProposer: The address of the proposer to challenge
params._signedCommitment: The signed commitment that the proposer is getting challenged for

params._blockHeaderProver: The address of the Relic block header prover contract
params._boltRegistry: The address of the BoltRegistry contract
params._reliquary: The address of the Relic Reliquary contract

resolveChallenge(bytes32,bytes,bytes,uin.details: anyone can call this function on a pending challenge, but only the challenged based proposerwill be able to provide a valid proof to counter it. If the challenge expires or the proof is invalid,the challenger will be rewarded with the bond + a portion of the slashed amount.

params._accountDataProof: The proof of the account data of the preconfirmed sender
params._blockHeaderProof: The proof of the block header of the target slot
params._challengeID: The unique ID of the challenge to resolve
params._inclusionProof: The Merkle proof of the transaction's inclusion in the block
params._transactionIndex: The index of the transaction in the block

CHALLENGE_BOND().notice: The bond required to open a challenge. This is to avoid spamming and DOS attacks on proposers. If a challenge is successful, the bond is returned to the challenger, otherwise it is sent to the based proposer.

MAX_CHALLENGE_DURATION().notice: The max duration of a challenge, after which it is considered resolved even if no one has provided a valid proof for it.

accountInfoProver().notice: The address of the account info prover contract

blockHeaderProver().notice: The address of the block header prover contract

boltRegistry().notice: The address of the BoltRegistry contract

challengeProposer(address,(uint256,uint2.notice: Challenge a proposer if it hasn't honored a preconfirmation.A challenge requires a bond to be transferred to this contract to avoid spamming.

challenges(bytes32).notice: The mapping of challenges, indexed by the unique ID of their inclusion commitment

reliquary().notice: The address of the Relic Reliquary contract

resolveChallenge(bytes32,bytes,bytes,uin.notice: Resolve a challenge by providing a valid proof for the preconfirmation.
